aws::graph::propositions: # Amazon Space Commerce Initiative
Project Kuiper Commerce will create entirely new industries.
Project Kuiper Commerce will provide global internet access that reaches every corner of our planet.
The Kuiper satellite constellation will be expanded to 7,000 satellites.
The Kuiper satellite constellation will provide high-speed internet access to underserved regions worldwide.
The Kuiper satellite constellation will support orbital manufacturing operations.
Advanced AI systems will coordinate the complex logistics of moving materials between Earth and the orbital platforms.
Advanced AI systems will coordinate the complex logistics of moving products between Earth and the orbital platforms.
Reusable spacecraft will be used for transporting materials and products.
Reusable spacecraft can complete the journey between Earth and orbital platforms in just four hours.
Space-based manufacturing facilities will initially focus on producing fiber optic cables.
Space-based manufacturing facilities will initially focus on producing semiconductor wafers.
Space-based manufacturing facilities will initially focus on producing pharmaceutical compounds.
Fiber optic cables, semiconductor wafers, and pharmaceutical compounds benefit from zero-gravity conditions.
Products manufactured in space will be returned to Earth via automated cargo capsules.
Automated cargo capsules will land at designated Amazon spaceports in Nevada.
Automated cargo capsules will land at designated Amazon spaceports in Australia.
Automated cargo capsules will land at designated Amazon spaceports in French Guiana.
Amazon's space commerce platform includes the first orbital fulfillment center.
The orbital fulfillment center is capable of storing products.
The orbital fulfillment center is capable of distributing products to other satellites and space stations.

metadata.header_path: /Amazon Pioneers Commercial Space Economy with Orbital Manufacturing Platform/
/Amazon Pioneers Commercial Space Economy with Orbital Manufacturing Platform/

text:
"Project Kuiper Commerce will create entirely new industries while providing global internet access that reaches every corner of our planet."

The Kuiper satellite constellation, expanded to 7,000 satellites, will provide high-speed internet access to underserved regions worldwide while supporting the orbital manufacturing operations. Advanced AI systems will coordinate the complex logistics of moving materials and products between Earth and the orbital platforms, using reusable spacecraft that can complete the journey in just four hours.

The space-based manufacturing facilities will initially focus on producing fiber optic cables, semiconductor wafers, and pharmaceutical compounds that benefit from zero-gravity conditions. These products will be returned to Earth via automated cargo capsules that land at designated Amazon spaceports in Nevada, Australia, and French Guiana.

Amazon's space commerce platform also includes the first orbital fulfillment center, capable of storing and distributing products to other satellites and space stations.
